Aniwatch was built using Android Studio, an official IDE provided by Google for Android development. Learn more at https://developer.android.com/studio
This app uses Firebase services such as Authentication and Firestore, provided by Google. Firebase helps us deliver a secure and smooth user experience. Visit https://firebase.google.com for details.
Aniwatch relies on the Android Software Development Kit (SDK) to function across Android devices. The SDK is a fundamental part of Android app development and is maintained by Google.
We use open-source libraries from GitHub to enhance functionality and performance. All libraries are credited to their respective creators and comply with their licenses.
Some icons and images used in Aniwatch may come from third-party open-source repositories or royalty-free platforms. Credits are given where applicable in the app or accompanying documentation.
All third-party tools, SDKs, and libraries used in this app are licensed under their respective terms. We respect and comply with these licenses as part of our commitment to open development.
Retrofit is a type-safe HTTP client developed by Square. It simplifies network operations and API integrations. Learn more at https://square.github.io/retrofit/
Glide is an image loading and caching library for Android focused on smooth scrolling. It is developed by Bumptech and is widely used for image handling. https://bumptech.github.io/glide/
Aniwatch uses Google\'s Material Components to ensure UI consistency and modern design standards. Learn more at https://m3.material.io/
